newsitem.title: MEXICO: Finance Ministry official gunned down in Mexico.
newsitem.headline: Finance Ministry official gunned down in Mexico.

text.p: A Mexican Finance Ministry official in charge of investigating money laundering was shot and killed after a high-speed car chase through the streets of Mexico City, officials said on Monday.
Finance Ministry officials confirmed that Section Director Pedro Jose Alvarez Porras was gunned down while driving with his wife through the capital early on Sunday.
Police reports said he was travelling through a suburb in the south of Mexico City when an unidentified car pulled up beside his black Ford Mustang and ordered him to stop.
In a bid to escape, Alvarez, 46, reportedly accelerated and the gunmen gave chase. They fired four shots, fatally wounding him and injuring his wife, before fleeing.
Alvarez's wife was said to be recovering from her injuries. Police said they had identified no suspects in the case and no further details were immediately available.
